author: Adam
text:
I run a limited company in the UK and we primarily sell wrist watches to customers in the UK/USA. We first heard about Grailed this year and after reading their terms of service, we signed up to sell on the platform. In all honesty, I was impressed with the platform however similar to others, our account was frozen for listing inauthentic items despite our items being genuine.

We have listed and sold these same items on multiple e-commerce platforms (Amazon, Bonanza, eBay) without being accused of listing inauthentic items.

To add to the confusion, we currently have active transactions on Grailed which we have not been able to access since our account was frozen.

I proceeded to contact Grailed through email and their initial response states "the account was frozen for listing counterfeit items." While I understand Grailed has to maintain a safe community for it's customers, they have blatantly disregarded the seller and failed to provide a clear explanation of which items were supposedly counterfeit.

In summary, if you are a seller:
- Potential to be a good platform for selling men's fashion
- It's very likely you will be accused of listing inauthentic items at some point.
- Your account will likely be frozen.


I will be sure to provide an update if our account is reinstated.


**Update 1: 
Thanks for the response. Our username is Timeford.


**Update 2: 
I sent an email to Grailed as suggested and their response was... "the items listed are counterfeit". 

I have received the exact same response each time. 

I've raised a few questions in my messages to Grailed and none of them have been answered.  There's been no further explanation of the issue and it seems like our message is being ignored as we have seen this exact same response to other reviews on trust pilot.

If you decide to use this platform to sell, be prepared to have your account frozen for listing counterfeit items. It doesn't matter if your items are authentic as this doesn't seem to impact the decision made by Grailed. 

If you're looking to sell on Grailed, save yourself the trouble and list your items on another platform.
title: An honest review of our experience selling with Grailed.

author: Gnargoyle
text:
EDIT: Grailed, as I stated in this review, at checkout it says "All purchases made through a PayPal account are eligible for PayPal Protection. Guest Checkout purchases are not protected by PayPal." There is no mention of Grailed's own 100% money-back guarantee in that disclaimer.

Paypal is not Grailed. You are not Paypal. Paypal's policy is not reflective of your own policy that you advertise on your site.

At the very least, since you won't assist in getting my money back as promised by the copy on your website, you should change that text to be clear for other customers so this doesn't happen to them. I'm not sure why you wouldn't do that unless you're actively trying to mislead people about your policy.

I've had a really good experience for years on your website otherwise, which is why this is so frustrating and disappointing.

--------

I ordered something over a month ago that never arrived, and tracking stopped at the end of May, so I have to assume the package is lost. I - apparently - used PayPal guest checkout when I purchased because I can't find the transaction on my Paypal account (which I find odd since I'm permanently signed in, and I do have the receipt with the transaction ID).

Jordan at Grailed customer service is telling me it's not covered because I used guest checkout, and I have pointed out that the website advertises:

"Every purchase on Grailed is protected by our 100% money-back guarantee."

And that: "Orders that never arrive, inauthentic items, and items not as described will be refunded—your satisfaction, guaranteed."

And that: "Every transaction on Grailed is covered by PayPal Purchase Protection."

With NO mention of guest checkout on their main trust page or on the money-back-guarantee page in the FAQ. 

I would have had to go to the help section, then that separate FAQ section hidden below there, to find the phrase "Guest Checkout purchases are not eligible for purchase protection," but even that implies it's Paypal's policy and not Grailed’s.

And in the checkout process, it also only says that guest purchases are not covered by Paypal, with no mention of Grailed. I’m out $350, and if they don’t return my money I’m going to send screenshots of their false advertising and my communication with them to the Better Business Bureau, but I’m sure they’ll just delete my account or something.
title: Grailed won’t honor their money back guarantee
